Picture.filename: 1 Rock Hard Studios - The empty unit
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - The empty unit
Picture.text: This picture was taken while we were searching for a unit in which to build the studio. The previous occupants had left it in quite a bad state.

Picture.filename: 2 Rock Hard Studios - Clearing and drying the unit
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Clearing and drying the unit
Picture.text: Taken quite soon after we had been given the keys, you can see that we had already taken most of the unnecessary mezzanine down. Also notice at the bottom of the upright, our little camping stove.

Picture.filename: 3 Rock Hard Studios - taking down the old mezzanine
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - taking down the old mezzanine
Picture.text: Once again taken on one of the early days. The fake leather sofa had been left in the unit. Honest

Picture.filename: 4 Rock Hard Studios - Looking up the unit
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Looking up the unit
Picture.text: A view from by the shutters. The last cross piece had to be lifted off by a fork-lift (thanks Stuff-it!) as it was SO heavy.

Picture.filename: 5 Rock Hard Studios - Phil teaching Dan how to lay bricks
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Phil teaching Dan how to lay bricks
Picture.text: The first wall of Rock Hard Studios. Dan is shown here learning how to build a straight wall - if only he'd listened.

Picture.filename: 6 Rock Hard Studios - Room 4 taking shape
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Room 4 taking shape
Picture.text: A view from by the shutters. In the back right corner you can see the beginnings of Room 4.

Picture.filename: 7 Rock Hard Studios - Working on getting electricity
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Working on getting electricity
Picture.text: Dan on the roof of the entrance hall, fitting the main electricity armoured cables. The old office has been completely removed and the space is ready for the Control Room.

Picture.filename: 8 Rock Hard Studios - Team work while building the Chill Out Room
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Team work while building the Chill Out Room
Picture.text: The crew helping to lift the large outer wall of the Chill Out Room into position. From left to right: Dick Smith, Chris Hilton, Ste Picton, Dan Atkinson, Andrew Cox, Paul Higham

Picture.filename: 9 Rock Hard Studios - Rooms 3 and 4 taking shape
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Rooms 3 and 4 taking shape
Picture.text: A view across the unit. Rooms 3 and 4 have had all their block-work done and they are close to completion.

Picture.filename: 10 Rock Hard Studios - Looking back down the unit
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Looking back down the unit
Picture.text: Looking back down the unit from by the fire-exit. The large wooden box in the foreground was full of scented wax. Strange.

Picture.filename: 11 Rock Hard Studios - Room 4 all shiny and new
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Room 4 all shiny and new
Picture.text: The completed Room 4 Rehearsal Room. The last time it would ever look so clean and tidy.

Picture.filename: 12 Rock Hard Studios - Starting to build the Live Room
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Starting to build the Live Room
Picture.text: Starting to lay Block for the Live Room. Slowly the shape of the studio is forming.

Picture.filename: 13 Rock Hard Studios - The Live Room taking shape
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - The Live Room taking shape
Picture.text: This is taken inside the Live Room while the block work was being completed. Note the speaker cabinets back left of the room - the old scaffolding... scary.

Picture.filename: 14 Rock Hard Studios - Studding the walls of the Live Room
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Studding the walls of the Live Room
Picture.text: Looking down into the new Live Room from the window into the Chill Out Room. Here we are putting the stud work onto the walls.

Picture.filename: 15 Rock Hard Studios - The plaster board goes on in the Live Room
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - The plaster board goes on in the Live Room
Picture.text: Taking a look across the Live Room as the plaster board goes up and the joint strips are put in place.

Picture.filename: 16 Rock Hard Studios - Installing lights in the Live Room
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Installing lights in the Live Room
Picture.text: The lights being installed in the Live Room, and cladding going on round the edges.

Picture.filename: 17 Rock Hard Studios - Finishing touches to the Live Room
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Finishing touches to the Live Room
Picture.text: The finishing touches being applied to the Live Room including painting the doors and fitting the cladding.

Picture.filename: 18 Rock Hard Studios - The Live Room in all its glory
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - The Live Room in all its glory
Picture.text: The finished live room set up, having tested the sound with a drum kit and some loud guitar.

Picture.filename: 19 Rock Hard Studios - Room 2 ready for a band
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Room 2 ready for a band
Picture.text: Room 2 all set up and ready for a band. Note the Sonor drum kit and monitor wedges.

Picture.filename: 20 Rock Hard Studios - Starting to clear the common areas
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Starting to clear the common areas
Picture.text: The beginning of the process to finish the common areas. The old partition walls have been removed ready for being replaced by blockwork.

Picture.filename: 21 Rock Hard Studios - Rambo looking through the wall
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - Rambo looking through the wall
Picture.text: Rambo looking through the hole in the wall left by the old boiler. Shortly after this picture was taken, the hole was filled in.

Picture.filename: 22 Rock Hard Studios - The entrance and corridor takes shape
Picture.tooltip: Rock Hard Studios - The entrance and corridor takes shape
Picture.text: Blockwork being built along the corridor and by the kitchen. The wall on the right is for Room 1.
